sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 Ã— C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 36 are there?
message_2:
There are four non-isomorphic groups of order 36. They are:

1. Cyclic group C_36
2. Direct product of two cyclic groups C_9 x C_4
3. Direct product of two cyclic groups C_3 x C_12
4. The semi-direct product of C_9 and C_4, also known as the Quaternion group of order 36.

These groups are non-isomorphic, meaning they have different structures and cannot be transformed into one another.
